definition: medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: He was also not much ceremonious, returned apt ugg then hurriedly let the matchmaker base out.
sentences.chinese: 他也不多客套，回去就趕緊讓媒婆打聽了。

sentences.english: Matchmaker What holiday is it? Do you know?
sentences.chinese: 媒婆你們知道今天是什麼日子嗎？

sentences.english: You’d be a terrifically hard sell even for the most accomplished matchmaker.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最能幹的媒婆，要把你推銷出去也相當困難。
李媒婆給他們的答案是毫無疑問的肯定。

sentences.english: The task Li now set herself was to get the Wang and Fu families to see eye to eye.
sentences.chinese: 李媒婆給自己設定的任務是讓王家和付家也這麼想。

sentences.english: Matchmaker No problem. I have an idea.
sentences.chinese: 媒婆沒問題，我會有辦法的。

definition: to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
